ptdb.kernel.bl.search

Class SearchCriteriaManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ptdb.kernel.bl.search.SearchCriteriaManager

  • public class SearchCriteriaManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The business layer class to handle the operations for saving and loading search criteria from the stored file system.
    Since:
    Ptolemy II 10.0
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Alek Wang
    Accepted Rating:
    red (wenjiaow)
    Proposed Rating:
    red (wenjiaow)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SearchCriteriaManager

        public SearchCriteriaManager()

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public static SearchCriteria open(java.lang.String searchCriteriaFileName,
                                  Configuration configuration)
                           throws SearchCriteriaParseException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        Open the file from the file system, and load the search criteria stored in it. Return the loaded search criteria back to the caller.
        Parameters:
        searchCriteriaFileName - The location and file name of the search criteria to be loaded.
        configuration - The configuration of the opening search criteria.
        Returns:
        The search criteria that contains the information stored in the file to be loaded.
        Throws:
        SearchCriteriaParseException - Thrown if there is any error during parsing the search criteria file.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if IO errors happened during reading of the search criteria file.

      • save

        public static boolean save(SearchCriteria searchCriteria,
                           java.lang.String searchCriteriaFile)
                    throws IllegalActionException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Save the search criteria to a file in the XML format.
        Parameters:
        searchCriteria - The DTO containing the search criteria to be saved.
        searchCriteriaFile - The file path and name where the criteria should be saved.
        Returns:
        true - if the search criteria is saved successful.
        False - if the search criteria is not saved successful.
        Throws:
        IllegalActionException - Thrown if the passed attributes' values cannot be obtained.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if error happens during writing the search criteria information to the file.
